comments:
Starting with an empty workspace run the 'New Java Project' wizard.  
Select "Use project folder as root for sources and class files" on the first 
page.  On the second page click "Add Folder" and add a folder called "src" 
(name not relevant).  Say 'Yes' to changing the output folder to the bin 
directory.  Click 'Finish' and an error dialog pops up with a "Widget is 
Disposed" exception in the error log. 

This occurs on both Eclipse 3.0 and 3.1, although it does not seem to happen 
all the time and only happens for the first project in the workspace.

In addition, if you now press 'Cancel' on the wizard, the project that has 
been created is not deleted.


The stack trace for the exception is as follows:

Martin, can you please have a look

I cannot reproduce this problem in I20050126-0800, since the new "New Java
Project" wizard does not allow to create new source folders any more. I could
not reproduce it with a linked source folder either.

With which build did you get the SWTException? Maybe the problem was also solved
with the fix for bug 78053 (children of a java project are not fetched any more,
until the project node gets expanded).

Closing as WORKSFORME for now.
